messages.message: @sreeraj is this present in our base image?
Searching for `ctx==` in requirements..* file does not show any matches

```"It appears that the original maintainer's domain name had expired, and the perpetrator registered it on May 14, 2022 (the same date where version 0.2.2 of ctx was uploaded). With control over the original domain name, creating a corresponding e-mail to receive a password reset e-mail would be trivial. After gaining access to the account, the perpetrator could remove the old package and upload the new backdoored versions."```
this looks fairly recent so our existing customer should not be impacted even if we use this dependency

well actually we certified 22.01, 22.03, 22.05 releases since 5/14 and I am about to certify another 21.10 so we still may be impacted if we
1. use the package in question
2. rebuild the image (which is mostly true)
@shaunak just did a quick check on 3.8 python image from master and does not look like ctx is pre-installed
when @sreeraj is around in the morning, he can help us do a more exhaustive check as well

1. searched for pip  across all files and greped for ctx to see if its installed, got nothing. 
2. Execed into one of py37 container (runner service) and pip list did not return ctx for release 22.05.0/22.01.0/21.10.0
Thank you @sreeraj!  This is very helpful.
@sudeep I couldn't find any service using BASE_PY38_IMAGE_TAG
We are not usng py38 anywhere
Ahh okay i had checked the base py38 image directly. Thanks for confirming
